ohha.puzzlecrafter.grid

Class Grid

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohha.puzzlecrafter.grid.Grid

  • public class Grid
extends Object
    This class serves as a conceptual wrapper for a two-dimensional integer array containing the puzzle grid cells' values. The actual state of the puzzle is completely contained in this class, as CellCoordinate objects only act as coordinates, completely agnostic to the value the puzzle may have at its coordinate.

    The cells, edges and vertices can all hold values to be interpreted by each concrete puzzle style as needed. For example, Fillomino stores in edges whether to use a thick, dashed or invisible line between cells.

    Cells, horizontal edges, vertical edges and vertices all have their own coordinate systems, where the top-left-most instance is at (0, 0), and the first component increases rightward and the second component increases downward. These are interweaved in the actual two-dimensional integer array that stores the values.

    Two special integers have been reserved (see CellCoordinate):

    • 0 always means a cell whose contents have not been determined by the solver. Solved puzzles will not contain the value 0.
    • -1 always means a cell that has been determined empty.
    The rest of the values may be interpreted freely by each puzzle. The Grid class does not enforce what values may be written into it, this is done by each puzzle.

      • containsCell

        public boolean containsCell(CellCoordinate c)
        Returns whether the coordinate given represents a cell contained in the grid.
        Parameters:
        c - the coordinate of the cell to be tested
        Returns:
        true if the grid contains the indicated cell, false otherwise

      • containsEdge

        public boolean containsEdge(EdgeCoordinate e)
        Returns whether the coordinate given represents an edge contained in the grid, including the outer frame.
        Parameters:
        e - the coordinate of the edge to be tested
        Returns:
        true if the grid contains the indicated edge, false otherwise

      • isInternalEdge

        public boolean isInternalEdge(EdgeCoordinate e)
        Returns whether the coordinate given represents an internal edge of the grid, that is an edge not on the outer frame. In other words, an edge is internal if there is a cell on both sides of it.
        Parameters:
        e - the coordinate of the edge to be tested
        Returns:
        true if the edge is an internal edge, false otherwise

      • isCellUndetermined

        public boolean isCellUndetermined(CellCoordinate c)
        Returns whether the value at the coordinate is undetermined or not. The value 'undetermined' represents a cell whose contents have not yet been determined by the solver.

        The value is named in the constant UNDETERMINED_CELL.

        Parameters:
        c - the coordinate in the puzzle grid to probe
        Returns:
        true if the cell is undetermined, false otherwise

      • isCellEmpty

        public boolean isCellEmpty(CellCoordinate c)
        Returns whether the value at the coordinate is empty or not. The value 'empty' represents a cell which has been determined empty by the solver.

        The value is named in the constant EMPTY_CELL.

        Parameters:
        c - the location in the puzzle grid to probe
        Returns:
        true if the cell is empty, false otherwise

      • isCellFilledIn

        public boolean isCellFilledIn(CellCoordinate c)
        Returns whether the value at the coordinate is filled in or not. 'Filled in' means the cell is not undetermined nor empty, i.e. its value represents something concrete. The interpretation of the concrete values is left for each puzzle style to specify.

        As 'filled in' is not a single specific value, it is not represented by a constant.

        Parameters:
        c - the location in the puzzle grid to probe
        Returns:
        false if the cell is undetermined or empty, true otherwise

      • getListOfCellCoordinates

        public List<CellCoordinate> getListOfCellCoordinates()
        Returns a list of coordinates to use when looping over every cell of the grid.
        Returns:
        a list containing coordinates for each cell in the grid

      • getListOfEdgeCoordinates

        public List<EdgeCoordinate> getListOfEdgeCoordinates()
        Returns a list of coordinates to use when looping over every edge of the grid.
        Returns:
        a list containing coordinates for each edge in the grid

      • getListOfInternalEdgeCoordinates

        public List<EdgeCoordinate> getListOfInternalEdgeCoordinates()
        Returns a list of coordinates to use when looping over every internal edge of the grid. See also isInternalEdge(EdgeCoordinate).
        Returns:
        a list containing coordinates for each internal edge in the grid

      • deepCopy

        public Grid deepCopy()
        Returns a deep copy of the Grid object it was called on.
        Returns:
        a deep copy of the Grid it was called on
